Welcome Guide
Map
Newsletter
Calendar
News
Offers
  1. What's Happening now in Elmhurst
  1. Community Events & Activities

  1. The Whole World a Bauhaus

    Visit the Elmhurst Art Museum's latest exhibit until April 20, celebrating the founding of the Bauhaus. Read on...

  2. 23rd Annual Art in Wilder Park

    Happening May 4 & 5, Art in Wilder Park is a great event showcasing artists in beautiful Wilder Park. Read on...

  3. Elmhurst Museum Day

    Celebrate the 23rd Annual Museum Day in Elmhurst, a special event commemorating the important cultural value of museums to communities worldwide on May 19. Read on...
/CivicAlerts.aspx


  1. Egg Hunt in Wilder Park




    April 20, 10 am
    Come early to meet with the Easter Bunny, who arrives at 9:00 am, and then be ready for the egg hunt at 10:00 am sharp. After the egg hunt is completed, they will have a dog costume contest, followed by a doggie egg hunt. This event is free and is presented by The Schiller Tea, Suburban Bank & Trust and Edward-Elmhurst Health. Visit epd.org for more information.



  1. 101st Annual Memorial Day Parade




    May 27, 9:30 am
    Step off at 9:30 a.m. at Third and York. Following the parade will be a Post-Parade Military Ceremony at Wilder Park.



  1. Taste of the Town: Food for Life



    May 16, 6 pm - 10 pm
    Save the Date for Taste of the Town: Food for Life, an Elmhurst food and drink sampling featuring food, wine and beer tastings, cooking demonstrations by local chefs, and music. Proceeds will benefit United Community Concerns Association to help feed local families in need. $60 in advance/$70 at the door.




  1. A department of the City of Elmhurst
    209 North York Street
    Elmhurst, IL 60126

    630.530.6018
    Email
